deviations.title: Threaded backend keeps multi-pick wave rounds as an extension
deviations.reason: Canonical VM rounds were aligned to one-step semantics; threaded backend still supports parallel waves for performance.
deviations.impact: Threaded round granularity differs from Lean canonical round semantics, while preserving tested trace-level contracts.
deviations.alternatives_considered: Forcing one-step threaded rounds would eliminate this divergence but materially reduces throughput and was deferred until certified-wave parity is complete.
